snippet: Bill de Blasio became alienated from his father, Warren Wilhelm, an economist who was wounded at Okinawa, was investigated for Communist sympathies, drank to excess, divorced and committed suicide.
abstract: Bill de Blasio, Democratic candidate for New York City mayor, had troubled and alienated relationship with his father, Warren Wilhelm, an economist who was wounded during World War II; Wilhelm became increasingly unstable after he was investigated for Communist sympathies in 1950s, drinking heavily and eventually committing suicide in 1979; de Blasio says of his father's decline that he 'learned what not to do' (Series: In the Running).
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio became alienated from his father, Warren Wilhelm, an economist who was wounded at Okinawa, was investigated for Communist sympathies, drank to excess, divorced and committed suicide.

headline.main: From His Father’s Decline, de Blasio ‘Learned What Not to Do’
headline.print_headline: From His Father’s Decline, de Blasio ‘Learned What Not to Do’
